example.eg: His peers voted him best actor.
example.egtrans: 他的同行选他为最佳演员。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 同等地位的人，同辈，同事，同行, 可堪匹敌的人

example.eg: Lord Mountbatten was a Peer of the British Realm.
example.egtrans: 蒙巴顿勋爵是一位英国的贵族。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 贵族成员, 皇室成员

example.eg: An accused person is entitled to be tried before a jury of his or her peers in some countries.
example.egtrans: 在一些国家，被指控的人有权在由自己同辈组成的陪审团面前受审。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 同辈, （地位、状况等）相当的人

dsense.name: peer
dsense.guideword: (computing: computer in network) (计算机网络中的)

example.eg: This network enables peers to share files and tasks.
If you peer closely, you can see the wind blowing the grass about.
example.egtrans: 如果你仔细看，就能看到草被风吹得摇摆。

example.eg: A frightened child in the cinema will sometimes peer between her fingers at the screen.
example.egtrans: 小孩子看电影的时候害怕，有时会用手捂住脸，从指缝看电影。

example.eg: Ana peered at her phone but couldn't read the number.
If you peer into the cave you can just about see the bear.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 向外窥探, 向外窥伺

example.eg: I was the only one of my peer group to go to university.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 同年龄组, 同年龄群体, 同辈群体

example.eg: Teenagers find it hard to resist peer pressure.
example.egtrans: 青少年发现很难抵抗来自同龄人的压力。

example.eg: I completed a peer review of my co-worker's performance.
